title: Lorraine Kelly says ‘someone’s going to get killed’ as she fumes over XR protest
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Lorraine Kelly launched a fuming rant against Extinction Rebellion protesters live on air, describing the situation as ‘horrendous’.

Activists have caused fury among London commuters after protesting on the London underground, targeting the Jubilee line and DLR and preventing people from getting to work.

After they covered the news on Good Morning Britain, hosts Susanna Reid and Ben Shephard cut to Lorraine Kelly who was left particularly angry by the situation.

Speaking to Susanna and Ben, Lorraine said: ‘Morning, this is horrendous. I don’t recognise my country, what is going on?

Lorraine Kelly is baffled by the whole situation (Picture: ITV)

‘Absolutely horrible. People just trying to get to their work for goodness sake on the train there, which is electric anyway.

‘I just don’t understand. It doesn’t make any sense to me. I think all of us have got sympathy for what they’re trying to do, but it’s just the way they’re going about it, it’s so toxic and divisive.

‘Somebody’s going to get killed. It’s just nuts, absolutely nuts.’

After the rant, Lorraine snapped back into promo mode to showcase the celebrity guests on the show.

After watching the clip of the protesters, Ben Shephard added: ‘It’s tiring isn’t it watching it? It’s really, really shocking. That aggressive atmosphere when you’re just trying to get to work.’

British Transport Police confirmed they have made four arrests so far at Stratford and Canning Town following the protest.

A spokesperson added: ‘We remain at Shadwell DLR station, where specialist teams are working to remove four other protesters.’
